Ratings.comment: I took three classes with Pedro. While unorganized and he sometimes goes on rants, he is extremely knowledgeable when it comes to content and understanding when it comes to grades. He wants the class to learn the content so he does not focus on grades as much as a similar level language class.

This man is the most unorganized being I have ever met. His grading criteria is flawed. Gives no feedback and pop quizzes are hard. The syllabus changes everyday and changed the night before. He refutes you ideas and thinks hes right. The class consisted on headaches and uncertainty. I would not recommend literally take it with abotone else

His syllabus is a mess. He's not clear about assignments and expectations. The pop quiz was irrelevant. He comes late to class all the time but has a mandatory attendance policy. His grading scale is flawed. Nobody knows what is going on. He always shoots down people's answers which makes people not want to participate. Would not recommend him!

Professor Pereira is extremely vague in his instruction and is not open to feedback. He is always changing the syllabus in regard to when work is due, and will inform the class of changes the night before an analysis is due. I would absolutely not recommend this professor due to his ambiguity regarding class and his expectations in general.

Professor is not clear about his expectations for the class and for the students. Also the professor doesn't give the students the opportunity to make questions or elaborate on topics relevant for the class.
Interesting and personable professor. I looked forward to going. I highly recommend his class.
Great professor

I do not recommend taking a class with her at all. All she does is talk on and on. She gives us last minute homework assignments and brings up random topics she's never covered in class before. She's a little rude too telling the class that ALMOST everyone speaks good Spanish. That is so rude to say to a class of students learning a new language.
No ones knows more Brazilian art history than her!

The absolute worst Spanish teacher I have ever had. Genuinely does not know how to communicate. It is never clear what she wants from the students and no one ever knew what to do for homework. Genuinely lost my ability to speak Spanish over the course of a semester with her. If you get her as a teacher, do yourself a favor, and get out.

I have had her for two semesters and have constantly been disappointed. She is a wonderfully nice lady but horrible instructor, and I emphasize horrible. She doesn't follow the syllabus, changes grade requirements constantly and emails hw assignments that take hours at 9pm the day before a 9:30am class. Would never take a class with her again.
Really fun teacher. Very helpful. She helped me outside of the classroom, which many teachers do not. It's obvious she cares about the subject and her students.
She is a good teacher.

Never posted grades.  Inconsistent on how she graded. Grades were random with no constructive criticism.  Definitely played favorites with her students.  I took three OSU Spanish classes before I took her class.  I had all As.  She gave me a D. I grieved the grade through the Student Advocacy Center, and eventually earned a C.

This teacher is all over the place. I have no idea what is going on any of the time and her tests are insanely random. She gives 10 MC questions worth 50% of each test grade and 2 short essays for the other 50%.  She assigns questions on a boring book and then she talks about the most random stuff in class. The grading is easy, but she's crazy.

Gabriel is a fantastic professor. He gives great feedback, responds to emails quickly, and is very understanding. Most of the work is done outside the classroom, but I advise you to meet with him weekly for corrections.  If you are nervous about taking this language, I highly recommend you taking his course, he is a very friendly and beyond helpful

Professor Foz is passionate about what he does. He goes above & beyond to make sure that you not only learn Portuguese, but fall in love with it as well. I'm so thankful to have had the opportunity to learn from him.

I loved Mr. Foz so much. He's technically only a GTA (as in he's in the process of getting his PhD at OSU), but I only found this out about a week ago, so I'm still submitting this. He cares so much about our success that he sat down individually during class and answered HW questions, paused any time to answer questions about vocab... So awesome.

Schirlei is my favorite professor here at OSU! She will do anything and everything to benefit your success (and that does include being flexible when life happens)! I am taking all three levels of intro Portuguese with her and am excited to continue to learn from such a great human being.

I really enjoyed having Silveira as a professor! She is very reasonable and very kind. The work is very easy to complete in 1101. She is always very accessible by email and she is helpful. Apart from wanting to help you have a positive classroom experience, she really enjoys getting to know her students as well! Highly recommend.

By far the best teacher I've had here at OSU thus far. Even if you just need a language this is a great place to start. I honestly looked forward to going to class every day. Do not hesitate to take this class!
Such a wonderful lady! Loved this class. It wasn't too difficult, just keep up with it :) You will definitely need the textbook. If you've had Spanish, this will be muito facil!
BEST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD. Very enthusiastic about portuguese, you wont feel bad messing up in front of her or the class because she makes the enviornment very laid-back. sexy  brasileira  too!!
Best prof I've had at OSU
She's awesome! She's so enthusiastic about Portuguese, and she'll give you the down and dirty on Brazil.
Very, very good teacher.  Made Portuguese very interesting and exciting.  I wish I could have her for the entire Port 101-104 course sequence.
